description.narrative: The objective of the Urban Local Government Development Project is to support improved performance in the planning, delivery, and sustained provision of priority municipal services and infrastructure by Ethiopia's urban local governments. In a letter dated December 24, 2010, the Ministry of Finance and Economic Development (MoFED) requested additional financing for the project to scale up its impact and development effectiveness. This project paper seeks the approval of the Executive Directors to provide an additional credit in an amount of SDRs 94.7 million (US$150 million equivalent) to the project. Of this amount, US$142 million is for performance grants, US$6 million is for implementation support, and US$2 million is unallocated. The additional credit would help finance the costs associated with scaling up the project's activities to enhance the impact of this well-performing project. Additional Financing will finance additional investments to improve the administration of the 19 participating cities and to help address a large infrastructure backlog. No changes to the project's development objectives, design, or implementation arrangements.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Sched. 2, Sect. I, D5(b) | Description :The results of the annual performance assessment by the independentevauators shall be incorporated into the Annual Performance Report to submitted by MWUD to IDA | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Sched. 2, Sect. V, A | Description :UCDBO shall carry out a Project Implementation Capacity Assessmentsatisfactory to IDA & prepare necessary prog. of support | Due Date :07-Jul-2008

Finance Agreement :Sched. 2, Sect. V, B | Description :UDCBO shall have furnished to IDA the list of Project coordinators for eachULG, who shall be designated by, & report to, their resp. Mayor's office, as satisfactory to IDA | Due Date :07-Jul-2008

Finance Agreement :Sched. 2, Sect. V, C | Description :The govt shall have ensured that the ULGs and MWUD shall have each preparedand subm to IDA a work program to carry out internal audits of its resp. project funds, as satisfactory to IDA | Due Date:31-Dec-2008

Finance Agreement :Sched. 2, Sect.I, D5(a) | Description :MWUD shall hire a team of independent evaluators to carry out annualperformance assessment of each eligible ULG to evaluate the performance grant target & indicators | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Each ULG prepares and adopts a revenue enhancement plan.
Urban Local Governments prepare annual finacial reports on time and as per required format ( number)
ULGs that increase the number of citizen groups participating in the CIP planning process ( number achieving an 85% increase over the baseline)
Each ULG submits approved CIP with evidence of adequate participation
Infrastructure asset inventories updated annually indicating additional assets and condition of existing assets.
ULGs that achieve annual targets specified in ULG revenue enhancement plans (Number that achieve an 85% increase at the end of calendar 2014)
ULGs using 75% of annual operations and maintenance budgets as specified in cities' CIPs
people in participating ULGs provided with acess to all season roads within a 500 mtrs range under ULGDP
Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under ULGDP
ULGS disseminating information to the public on budgets(including investment plans), expenditures, physical progress of investments, and results of bid evaluation and contract awards)
ULGs producing timely external audit reports, which is either unqualified or qualified with minor comments
New cities meeting access criteria for a potental second ULGDP
people in urban areas provided with access to improved water sources under ULGDP
Drainage systems constructed under the ULGDP
Improved latrines constructed under the project
